title: The proxemic web: designing for proxemic interactions with responsive web design.
description: What if your dekstop would behave like a smartphone depending on your spacial orientation and distance to it? This paper flips the concept of responsive web design over its heel and describes a prototypical system where an ordinary desktop enhanced with physical space awareness, begins to exhibit 'reverse responsive' capabilities.

publication.title: Proceedings of the 2014 ACM International Joint Conference on Pervasive and Ubiquitous Computing

title: QuoDocs: improving developer engagement in software documentation through gamification.
description: What if you never lost a conversation you had with your colleagues. What if never had to search massive conversations for the bits of information that matter to you. This paper describes a system - QuoDocs - that enables you to record verbal and writen conversations, directly from within the browser to collaborate and retrieve historical conversations in a snap second.

publication.title: CHI 2014 Extended Abstracts on Human Factors in Computing Systems

specialNote: This paper was a precursor to popular apps like 'HipChat' and 'Slack'
